c74object.name: bach.enharm
c74object.description: Modifies the enharmonicity of the incoming pitches, either by adding diatonic steps, or via automatic respelling

inlet.digest: Difference in diatonic steps, or "auto" symbol

objarg.name: delta_steps_or_auto
objarg.description: The argument sets the difference in diatonic steps (if it is an integer) or toggles the automatic retranscription mode (if it is the "auto" symbol). See llll method to know more.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs the operation on the most recently input data.

method.name: llll
method.description:
The function outputs an llll formatted as the incoming one, where each numeric pitch has been replaced by an enharmonic respelling, chosen according to the state of the right inlet.
If the right inlet (or argument) receives a number, this is assumed to be the number of diatonic steps to be added to the incoming ones. For instance, if the right inlet receives 2, a C#4 will be transcribed as Ebbb4, since two diatonic steps run between C to E.
If the right inlet (or argument) receives the "auto" symbol, the pitches are automatically respelled.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
